Answer from LLM is {'query': 'what did the president say based on document', 'result': 'Based on the document, the President said:

*   He greeted Madam Speaker, Madam Vice President, the First Lady and Second Gentleman, Members of Congress and the Cabinet, Justices of the Supreme Court, and his fellow Americans.
*   He noted that after COVID-19 kept them apart last year, they are finally together again, meeting as Democrats, Republicans, and Independents, but most importantly as Americans with a duty to one another, the American people, and the Constitution, and an unwavering resolve that freedom will always triumph over tyranny.
*   He stated that six days prior, Russia’s Vladimir Putin miscalculated in thinking he could shake the foundations of the free world and make it bend to his menacing ways, believing he could roll into Ukraine and the world would roll over. Instead, Putin met a "wall of strength" from the Ukrainian people, whose fearlessness, courage, and determination inspire the world, from President Zelenskyy to every Ukrainian.
*   He reiterated his commitment to younger transgender Americans, stating that he will always have their back as President so they can be themselves and reach their God-given potential.
*   He mentioned that while it often appears there is never agreement, it isn't true, as he signed 80 bipartisan bills into law last year, covering areas such as preventing government shutdowns, protecting Asian-Americans from hate crimes, and reforming military justice.'} and time taken is 9.311 seconds
